data.title: Thailand SEC Plans DLT-Based Debt Trading System
data.description:
According to Odaily, the Thailand Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is preparing to implement a Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT)-based debt instrument trading system. The initiative aims to encourage securities companies to engage in digital token trading. SEC Deputy Secretary-General Jomkwan Kongsakul stated that the regulatory body has approved four digital token projects and is evaluating two more, focusing on green tokens and investment-driven plans.

Kongsakul explained that purchasing bonds from the primary market currently takes 7-14 days before they can be traded in the secondary market. Investors face challenges such as limited access to certain products and high costs with low liquidity for some bonds. Issuers also deal with extensive manual paperwork, leading to delays and errors. Utilizing DLT is expected to enhance efficiency, streamline processes, and address obstacles in the capital markets.

The SEC aims to fully digitize the bond trading system in both primary and secondary markets, covering settlement, trading, investor registration, and return payments. Kongsakul assured that competition will remain open, allowing companies with their own DLT infrastructure to establish independent chains, provided they ensure interoperability within unified standards. Other companies can access the SEC's public chain at an affordable cost. Looking ahead, multiple trading chains may emerge, all interconnected through shared ledgers, with completion anticipated soon.

Existing financial products will be retained but converted into digital equivalents to facilitate smooth transactions on the DLT network. This approach promotes fractional trading at lower costs and enhances liquidity by introducing more participants, enabling real-time trading and reducing settlement issues.

Additionally, the SEC is developing the SEC Open API data platform to provide comprehensive data on all listed companies, aiding investors in better analysis and more informed investment decisions.

data.title: Encrypted collaboration terminal project Herd completes $1.8 million Pre-Seed round of financing, led by Semantic Ventures
data.description:
Odaily Planet Daily News According to official news, the encrypted collaborative terminal project Herd announced the completion of a $1.8 million Pre-Seed round of financing, led by Semantic Ventures, with participation from Archetype and Hardi Meybaum. 
Herd is building a collaborative terminal (coterminal) for contracts, allowing users to work with agents to combine existing on-chain contracts into off-chain and on-chain outputs.

data.title: Cryptocurrency phishing scams caused losses of $10.25 million in January, mostly to Ethereum network users
data.description: Odaily Planet Daily News Blockchain security company Scam Sniffer reported that cryptocurrency phishing scams stole $10.25 million from 9,220 victims in January, a 56% drop from the $23.58 million loss in December. However, the report pointed out that criminals are constantly evolving and adopting more sophisticated attack methods. According to Scam Sniffer data, Ethereum network users are the most affected by phishing scams, accounting for more than 80% of the stolen funds. Losses on Ethereum exceeded $8.6 million, while BNB Chain and Arbitrum users lost $710,000 and $572,000, respectively. Polygon and Optimism also lost approximately $191,000 and $82,000, respectively. (Cryptoslate)

data.title: Polymarket predicts that the probability of "the United States establishing a national Bitcoin reserve in 2025" has risen to 47%
data.description:
Odaily Planet Daily News Polymarket predicts that the probability of "the United States establishing a national Bitcoin reserve in 2025" has risen to 47%. The cumulative bet amount for this prediction is currently $687,000, and the deadline is December 31, 2025.
The judgment criteria are that the US government holds any amount of Bitcoin in its reserves, excluding Bitcoin confiscated by the US government. The main source of judgment will be official information from the US government or the Federal Reserve, and will also refer to credible reports with consensus recognition.
Earlier today, David Sacks, director of AI and cryptocurrency at the White House, said at a press conference in Washington on Tuesday about potential Bitcoin reserves: "This is one of the top issues we will consider as a working group within the government. We are still waiting for some cabinet members in the working group to be confirmed, so it is still in a very early stage. But this is one of the top issues we have to consider."

data.title: Planet Lunch News
Thailand SEC adopts DLT to reform digital token and bond trading
data.description:
Odaily Planet Daily News The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) of Thailand is preparing to deploy a DLT-based debt instrument trading system, with the main goal of encouraging securities companies to engage in digital token trading.
According to Jomkwan Kongsakul, deputy secretary-general of the SEC, the regulator has approved four digital token projects and is evaluating two more projects, focusing on green tokens and investment-driven programs.
Kongsakul explained that it takes 7-14 days to buy bonds from the primary market before they can be traded in the secondary market. Investors also face challenges such as limited access to certain products and the high cost and poor liquidity of some bonds.
At the same time, issuers need to deal with a lot of manual paperwork, which is prone to delays and errors. Therefore, the use of DLT is expected to ensure efficiency and simplify processes while addressing obstacles in the capital market.
The regulator aims to fully digitize the bond trading system in the primary and secondary markets, including settlement, trading, investor registration and return payment. Kongsakul promised that competition will remain open because companies with their own DLT infrastructure can build independent chains as long as they ensure interoperability within unified standards. Other companies can access the SEC’s public chain at an affordable cost. Going forward, multiple trading chains are likely to emerge, with all DLT-based systems interconnected through a shared ledger, which is expected to be completed soon.
Existing financial products will remain but will be converted to digital counterparts to facilitate smooth trading on the DLT network. This approach facilitates fragmented trading at a lower cost and improves liquidity by bringing in more participants, while enabling real-time trading and reducing settlement issues.
In addition, the regulator is developing the SEC Open API data platform to provide comprehensive data on all listed companies, helping investors conduct better analysis and make more informed investment decisions. (Bangkok Post)

data.title: Canadian blockchain company Neptune buys 20 BTC and 1 million DOGE
data.description:
Odaily Planet Daily News Canadian blockchain company Neptune Digital Assets Corp. announced that it has increased its holdings by 20 BTC at an average price of $99,833, totaling approximately $2 million. The acquisition was carried out from January 26 to February 3, 2025, increasing Neptune's total Bitcoin holdings to 376 BTC.
In addition to expanding its Bitcoin reserves, Neptune also purchased 1,000,000 DOGE through strategic derivatives on December 27, 2024 at an average price of $0.37, further diversifying its cryptocurrency portfolio.
